content: This is a relatively small refactor which also adds a few lemmas I want to use elsewhere.
But it conflicts in the nice way where, if this is merged first, I need to do less work on the other refactor.
:ping_pong:

I think the name change is bad in that it does not indicate the key difference between ordinal minimum and the infimum in a complete lattice: sets of ordinals always achieve their minimum, because they are well founded

This isn't a name change: we completely ditch ordinal.min in favor of the more general infi. We more generally have the theorem that nonempty sets in a well-ordered conditionally_complete_linear_order contain their infimum, see docs#Inf_mem.
Of course, with infi, we also have all of the other relevant theorems for infima at our disposal.
And we can interface with Inf much more comfortably, without having to call ordinal.min on a subtype.
I did a similar refactor on cardinals a while back: #13410
